description: '''Paulo Emilio Vanzolini''' ({{IPA|pt|ˈpawlu eˈmiliu vɐ̃zoˈlini}}; April 25, 1924 – April 28, 2013) was a Brazilian scientist and music composer. He was best known for his [[samba]] compositions, including the famous ''"Ronda", "Volta por Cima"'', and ''"Boca da Noite"'', and for his scientific works in [[herpetology]]. He is considered one of the greatest samba composers from [[São Paulo]]. Until his death, he still conducted research at the [[University of São Paulo]] (USP).
